intro: Hygrophila ovata, commonly known as the oval hygrophila, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and spikes of small, tubular flowers. The plant is typically found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of slow-moving water bodies. Its adaptability to aquatic and semi-aquatic environments makes it a common sight in wetland ecosystems. Hygrophila ovata is also cultivated as an ornamental plant in water gardens and ponds.
